intro: Caricinella, commonly known as the "false arrowhead," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat, often found in wetlands and marshes. The plants typically have arrowhead-shaped leaves, which give them their common name. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Caricinella species are often used in wetland restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality.
